phantom.flag

Class Flag

  • java.lang.Object
    • phantom.flag.Flag

  • public class Flag
extends Object
    Flag (banner stuff) useful for copy a banner from a block into an item stack or whatnot. Holds blueprint information for banners and can be loaded or applied to items or blocks
    Author:
    cyberpwn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Flag(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      Create a flag representing the given banner block
      Flag(org.bukkit.DyeColor baseColor)
      Create an empty banner with a base color
      Flag(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Create a flag representing a banner item's layers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Add a layer to this flag

      Add a layer to this flag

      Get the base color of this flag
      GList<FlagLayer> getLayers()
      Get a direct reference to all of the flag layers

        public Flag(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Create a flag representing the given banner block
        Parameters:
        block - the block. Does nothing if it is not a banner

      • Flag

        public Flag(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Create a flag representing a banner item's layers. Does nothing if it is not a banner
        Parameters:
        item - the item. Does nothing if it isnt a banner

    • Method Detail

      • toItem

        public org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack toItem(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack is)
        Convert the supplied banner item's layers into this flags layers
        Parameters:
        is - the itemstack (banner) does nothing if the item is not a banner
        Returns:
        the same itemstack with modified bannermeta (or the same item if it isnt a banner)

      • toItem

        public org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack toItem()
        Create an banner itemstack with this flags contents
        Returns:
        the item

      • toBlock

        public void toBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block b)
        Apply this flags contents to a block. Does nothing unless this block is a banner type
        Parameters:
        b - the block
